item.title: [pi] Incomparable Ints?
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

for(int i : mageGear) {
if(o.playerEquipment[o.playerWeapon] == mageGear[i]) {
o.mageKC += 2;
c.sendMessage("you now have "+c.mageKC+" mage tier kills");
o.getAchievements().newAchievementCompleted();
}
}
private int[] mageGear  = {1381, 1383, 1385, 1387};

item.title: [pi] Incomparable Ints?
item.dc:creator: @chazion chazion
item.description:
@chazion wrote:

I’m trying to make it so when you are wielding and item and you kill a player whilst wielding that item you gain a point in that ‘tier’.
I undestand what the error’s telling me, I just don’t know why…??

here’s my code

for(int i: mageGear) { if(o.playerEquipment[o.playerWeapon] == (mageGear)) { o.mageKC += 2; c.sendMessage("you now have "+c.mageKC+" mage tier kills"); o.getAchievements().newAchievementCompleted(); } }

the string i’m using…

private int []mageGear = {1381, 1383, 1385, 1387};

and the error…

src\server\model\players\PlayerAssistant.java:1798: incomparable types: int and
int[]
                                                if(c.playerEquipment[c.playerWea
pon] == meleeGear) {

     ^
src\server\model\players\PlayerAssistant.java:1804: incomparable types: int and
int[]

pon] == (mageGear)) {
